documents.title: woman involved in a41 crash has serious injuries
text: a woman in her 40s is suffering a number of serious injuries after a crash involving a car and a lorry on the a41 this afternoon .
the west midlands ambulance service says she was a passenger in the car , which hit the back of the lorry .
an elderly woman who was driving the car and a young girl , who was a passenger escaped with minor injuries and were taken to hospital as a precaution .
the lorry driver was unhurt .

text: the annual coracle races have been taking place on the river severn in shrewsbury today , in aid of macmillan cancer support‎ .
as you can see , some people were better at it than others ( watch out for the pale blue coracle capsizing ) .

text: train passengers are being warned there 'll be a revised timetable tomorrow for london midland and virgin trains services .

text: bridgnorth 's mayor says she fears her town could be forgotten following the biggest shake-up of parliamentary boundaries in living memory .

documents.title: man hurt in crash on a41 near whitchurch
text: one person 's been flown to hospital in stoke after a crash involving a lorry and a car near whitchurch .
emergency crews were called to the a41 heath road at prees heath at 14:30 and they are still at the scene .
the a41 is closed southbound at the moment between the b5395 heath road junction and the a49 junction .

documents.title: paralym telford archer out at the quarter-final stage
text: telford 's jodie grinham has been knocked out of the archery competition at the paralym at the quarter-final stage .
she lost 136-137 to her opponent from iran .
our girl @ twitterid put up an awesome fight in a very close match , but sadly lost 137 to 136 .
we still think your awesome !

documents.title: fire service pledges to respond to every fire call
text: more than 5,000 calls to shropshire 's fire service turned out to be false alarms over the past three years .
that 's almost half of them .
but , the shropshire fire and rescue service says it will continue to respond to every call , rather than follow the lead of some fire services , which wait for confirmation there is an actual fire .

documents.title: shropshire mep 'delighted ' with choice of next ukip leader
text: the shropshire-based ukip mep jill seymour appears to be pleased with the choice of diane james as their next party leader .
speaking at the ukip party conference , she said : she [ james ] will take our party to the next level , carrying on the amazing achievements of nigel farage .
`` theresa may should be very concerned right now . ''
i 'm delighted at the appointment of @ twitterid as new # ukip leader .

documents.title: watch : power station statues delivered to broseley
text: life-sized statues which were on display at the now-closed ironbridge power station are being installed in broseley today .
other donated artefacts will be put on show at the town 's new heritage centre .
they included this sculpture of a horse .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: police hunt three white men following attack
text: police say they are looking for three white men in their 20s following an attack in donnington last night .
a 21-year-old man needed hospital treatment after being stabbed in the neck with a broken bottle and the police say the attack could have been racially motivated .
the descriptions of the men are limited - the police say one of them was around 6ft tall , clean shaven and wearing a grey hooded top and bottoms .

well , who better to ask than the children themselves ?

documents.title: man stabbed in the neck in donnington
text: a 21-year-old man has been stabbed in the neck with a broken bottle in donnington in what the police believe was a racially motivated attack .
the police say it happened at around 01:00 while the man was in the park off st matthews road with friends .
he suffered a cut to the neck when a fight broke out with a group of men and he went to the princess royal hospital for treatment , but has since been discharged .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather watchers : more grey clouds over shropshire

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers missing veteran defenceman
text: telford tigers will be without veteran defenceman jonathan weaver and and young forward adam taylor this weekend , after both up injuries against manchester last weekend .
they travel to guildford tomorrow , to face the flames before returning to the telford ice rink for the visit of the sheffield steeldogs on sunday .
weaver is expected to to be missing for six weeks and joe miller is also out , but the tigers made a positive start to the season , winning both their opening games .
it 's just frustrating for those guys to start the way they did , especially weaves and joe , with how the season has gone for them so far .
it 's very start and stop .
they 're both working hard and doing all they can to be ready to play again . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : long mynd provides stunning backdrop for film
text: mountain biker james russell shares his love for the long mynd in a special video from smn film showing off the stunning landscape of south shropshire .
the south shropshire based production company is currently developing a project with a series of films featuring people who have strong connections to the landscape of the shropshire hills .
the films are expected to be shot over the course of a year showing how the landscape changes with the seasons .

the disruption has been caused by a landslide at watford junction .
it 's affecting london midland and virgin trains .

documents.title: police warn protest march may cause traffic disruption
text: the police say they are expecting tomorrow 's dalian atkinson protest march in telford to be peaceful , but warn it could cause some traffic congestion .
the march is expected to start at the town park , before passing along st quentin gate , grange central , lawn central and woodhouse central , finishing at malinsgate police station .
traffic around the town centre could be disrupted between 13:00 and 17:00 , police say .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury manager tells fans good things are round the corner
text: micky mellon says it 's been a frustrating couple of weeks results-wise for shrewsbury town fans , but he believes they are n't far away from hitting top form .
town have won two and lost three in their last five league games , leaving them just two points off the relegation zone in league one .
but mellon said they have better players than last season and are running opposing teams closer .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: council could start enforcing street-parking in telford
text: telford and wrekin council is considering taking over responsibility for street parking from the police .
it would mean the local authority would be responsible for stopping motorists blocking roads and double yellow lines .
the leader of telford and wrekin council , shaun davies , has discussed the move in a recent meeting with the new police and crime commissioner for west mercia , john campion .
and a council committee will look into the idea later this autumn .

documents.title: end of telford mobile library service criticised
text: the leader of the opposition conservative group on telford and wrekin council has criticised the authority 's decision to end the mobile library service .
branch libraries in dawley , donnington , hadley and stirchley will be taken over by town and parish councils , and opening hours will be cut at madeley , newport , southwater and wellington .
the move will save £ 383,000 a year , but at least 15 full time librarians will lose their jobs .
councillor andrew eade thinks the closure of the mobile library service is wrong .

documents.title: headlines : police prepare for atkinson protest march ; shifnal neighbourhood plan approved ; musician elected councillor
text: our top stories this lunchtime :
- police expect dalian atkinson protest march to be peaceful
- shifnal votes to approve local plan
- bishop 's castle musician elected to shropshire council
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shifnal votes in favour of local development plan
text: people in shifnal have overwhelmingly backed the creation of a neighbourhood plan - setting out how they want to see the town developed in the future .
there was a turnout of 30 % ( almost twice the turnout for the recent police and crime commissioner elections ) and 93 % voted to approve the plan .
the plan will now have to be considered when planning applications go before shropshire council .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather : another grey afternoon ahead
text: we 'll avoid the showers and there might even be a little bit of sun this afternoon , but we 'll also have a lot of grey cloud .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: nhs hopes to reassure patients over whitchurch gp move
text: shropshire 's health commissioners say there has been a `` growing level of anxiety '' over the closure of richmond house surgery in whitchurch .
and the shropshire ccg 's clinical chair julian povey says he hopes the announcement that a temporary gp surgery will be set up at whitchurch community hospital will calm some of those fears .
about 3,800 patients will transfer over , until a permanent replacement can be found for richmond house and the ccg says more details about the temporary surgery will be announced next month .
i would like to thank all patients for their patience and understanding .
by announcing that the hospital will be the location of the caretaker gp service we are hoping that it will ease some of those anxieties . ''

documents.title: protest march following death of footballer
text: a march will take place in telford tomorrow by campaigners demanding answers about the death of the former aston villa footballer dalian atkinson .
mr atkinson , who was 48 , died shortly after being tasered by police in trench last month .
an investigation is under way by the independent police complaints commission and two officers have been suspended .

documents.title: local musician wins shropshire council seat
text: a local musician , who has featured on the bbc shropshire introducing show , has been elected to shropshire council .
jonny keeley , who 's a member of the band .
fight the bear , won yesterday 's by-election in bishop 's castle , holding the seat for the liberal democrats .
he .
up twice as many votes as the conservative candidate , with labour coming a distant third .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: rare pine marten filmed in shropshire
text: last year the first confirmed sighting of a wild pine marten in england for over a century was recorded in a shropshire woodland .
now stuart edmunds at shropshire wildlife trust has managed to film two in a fortnight .
another area , another # shropshire # pinemarten and not far from where we found potential scat .
exciting day !

documents.title: afc telford fitness tests before saturday 's game
text: afc telford united will give late fitness tests to defender darren campion and midfielder jack rea before tomorrow 's fa cup tie against worcester city at bromsgrove .
campion suffered a knee injury at gainsborough last weekend - and rea 's been absent , long-term , with an ankle problem .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: false alarms cause problems for fire service
text: shropshire fire service say that 99 % of automatic fire-alarms turn out to be false .
to save money , firefighters in the west midlands , staffordshire and north wales now wait until a follow-up 999 call confirms there 's been a fire - before sending a fire-engine .
shropshire 's area manager john das gupta says they have no plans to change the way they do things here .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: taxi drivers fight for better pay and conditions
text: drivers who work for the shropshire private-hire firm go-carz say they 'll fight their corner to improve pay and conditions .
they say talks with management have got nowhere - and they 've disputed the company 's claim that a strike in telford yesterday came completely out of the blue .
during the day over 170 drivers stayed off work during the busiest times .
instead of taking fares they went on convoy through telford town centre to draw attention to their campaign .

carl wilday , the managing director of the firm , said he had no `` official communication from any group of drivers about any particular grievance '' but was `` working '' with some individual drivers over `` small '' `` teething '' problems .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

it 's happened near watford junction , operator london midland has confirmed and it is understood the accident was caused by flooding in the area .
a spokesman for london midlands and virgin services said they 'd be disrupted from the north-west of england , scotland , and the midlands into euston station in london .

the striker up a knock in the defeat at bury and has n't trained all week .
the shrewsbury manager micky mellon says he 'll be a big loss , but he has other players ready to take their chance .

Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: whitchurch hospital to host gp services
text: when the richmond house gp surgery closes at the end of october , about 3,800 of its patients will be transferred to a temporary gp surgery at whitchurch community hospital instead .
the shropshire clinical commissioning group says it 's expecting it to remain there for 18 months , while a permanent solution can be found .
richmond house is closing because several of the gps are retiring and another is moving away and because the lease on the building is up .
we have every confidence in the ccg to appoint a new provider and we ask patients to remain loyal to richmond house surgery until an announcement is made in early october . ''

documents.title: council backs libraries plan
text: telford and wrekin council has backed plans to hand control of a number of libraries over to parish councils and to close the borough 's mobile library service .
it is expected to be completed by april and save £ 383,000 , as well as resulting in 16 job losses .
@ twitterid says impact on library services minimal compared with other part of country and backed by cabinet
@ twitterid that 's bull mr davies,50 % cut in buying , charging for volunteer run sessions is a disgrace

documents.title: telford councillors discuss library plans
text: plans to hand a number of libraries in telford over to parish councils and to close the borough 's mobile library service are being discussed by telford and wrekin councillors right now .
the authority is making the move to save money and it will probably result in 16 job losses .
councillor liz clare told the meeting : `` this has been a difficult journey '' and added that they would be losing `` significant expertise '' with the job losses .

documents.title: honour for shropshire vc hero
text: a paving slab has been unveiled in london , in honour of an oswestry soldier who was awarded the victoria cross 100 years ago today .
lieutenant colonel john `` tally ho vc '' campbell received the honour for rallying the coldstream guards in the somme by blowing his hunting horn .

historians from the the chase project military research group say there 's a good case for the memorial slab to be laid in shropshire , but that his official paperwork recorded his place of birth as the coldstream guard barracks in westminster .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: taxi drivers say meetings with management have 'gone nowhere '
text: protesting telford taxi drivers say they 've had several meetings with go carz management to discuss their grievances , but the talks have got nowhere .
and they dispute claims from the company 's managing director that today 's walk-out had come completely out of the blue .

the drivers say they 've had a number of issues with management over recent months , including a dispute over the amount they have to pay to operate under the go carz name and feel they have n't been treated fairly .
we 've had several meetings with them .
at first it started off slowly getting changed and then all of a sudden it ground to a halt . ''

documents.title: shropshire towns win heart of england in bloom awards
text: five shropshire towns have won heart of england in bloom awards today .
shrewsbury won the gold award in the small city and large park categories , as well as a horticultural excellence award for the dingle .
ludlow , bridgnorth , oswestry and newport also won gold awards and there were gold awards for four shropshire parks and two pub gardens .

documents.title: taxi drivers begin second protest around telford town centre
text: the roads around telford town centre are about to get very busy with striking go carz drivers staging a demonstration against the company 's management .
they say around 100 cars are taking part and driving in convoy around the box road .

documents.title: offer to protesting drivers from go carz boss
text: drivers working for go carz have been staging another walk-out this afternoon , disrupting the school-run .
the company 's managing director , carl wilday , has apologised to customers and says he hopes this will be a one-off .

mr wilday said he would be willing to sit at a table with the drivers and discuss their grievances , which are thought to concern the introduction of a new system which prevents the drivers from turning down jobs .
if the drivers concerned bring something to the table that we can resolve , then we will do our upmost to resolve it . ''

documents.title: your photos : early morning dew on cobwebs
text: there 's definitely an autumnal feeling in the air and we 're starting to see more photos like this one , sent in by one of the bbc weather watchers .
we 've also seen plenty of photos of mist around the county , but that should be clearing as the afternoon wears on .
if you have a photo you 'd like to share with us , you can get in touch via email , facebook and twitter .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: taxi boss says drivers strikes have come 'out of the blue '
text: the managing director of go carz , carl wilday , says today 's unofficial strike by about 50 drivers has come `` completely out of the blue '' .

mr wilday said nobody had approached him with any official grievance and he does n't know who is leading today 's protest , although he said he has had individual discussions with drivers on a range of issues .
he also suggested some drivers are just following the crowd and do n't know what the protest is about .

documents.title: arrest after car hits pedestrians
text: a man has been arrested after a car hit a group of pedestrians on the high street in cleobury mortimer in the early hours of sunday morning .
the 19-year-old from kidderminster was detained on sus of driving a vehicle dangerously and he 's now been released on bail .
one of the pedestrians , a 32-year-old man , is critically ill in hospital with a head injury and various broken bones .

documents.title: headines : arrest after car hits pedestrians ; taxi driver strike ; bronze medal for canoeist
text: a recap of our top stories :

documents.title: damp and misty weather holding up the harvest
text: the damp and misty weather we 've had this month is making life difficult for shropshire farmers wanting to bring in the harvest .
sam barker at great berwick farm told me that every time they get rain it puts back the harvest by a day and a half .
and he explained that crops in damp weather stay damp and if they 're stored when they 're wet they go mouldy very quickly .
we just need a bit of wind really and a bit of sunshine .
sunday was great , that was a really good combining day , but this week we 've not done any . ''

documents.title: shropshire leisure centre cuts delayed
text: shropshire council has agreed to delay cuts to leisure services , to allow more time for discussions with parish councils and other local organisations .
the authority has been planning to reduce the subsidy it pays teme leisure , which operates leisure centres at bishop 's castle , ludlow , cleobury mortimer and church stretton .
the council said the cuts are now on hold until 2018 .

documents.title: go carz drivers stage protest
text: dozens of taxi drivers working for go carz have staged a walk-out in telford this morning .
the company says about 50 have been taking part , leading to delays for some customers , but that it still had 90 cars operating and no jobs had to be cancelled .

go carz says the dispute is over a new booking system , which means that drivers can no longer decline jobs , and a call from the drivers for lower rents - the firm says it is willing to hold `` reasonable discussions '' with them .

to be blunt , if anyone was really unhappy they could quite easily go and work for another taxi firm , which does happen from time to time - drivers moving between firms is quite common in the industry . ''

documents.title: fire service says it has 'moral obligation ' to rescue animals
text: shropshire fire and rescue service says it 's not going to stop rescuing large animals - a move taken by north wales fire and rescue , in a bid to save money .
around 50 animal rescues a year are carried out by shropshire fire and rescue service , costing a total of between £ 40,000 and £ 70,000 a year .
on tuesday , two young horses were rescued from a ditch near cleobury mortimer - they 'd been part of a herd that panicked in the storms .

documents.title: ccg chief says deficit not out of control
text: the man in charge of shropshire 's clinical commisioning group ( ccg ) , david evans , has denied the deficit is getting out of control and said he is looking to reduce it to £ 14.5m by the end of the financial year .
the overspend is currently £ 18m and the ccg had forecast it could rise to as high as £ 31m by next april if no action is taken .
mr evans said the ccg would work to `` control demand '' , especially for expensive hospital services and look to get patients treated closer to home .
he also said that lessons could be learnt from the telford ccg , which is not in deficit , also led by mr evans .

documents.title: promise that heath cuts wo n't hurt patients
text: the man who has recently taken on responsibility for the accounts at the shropshire clinical commissioning group says he understands that urgent action is needed , but he does n't want to do anything which could harm patients .

andrew nash is also the chief finance officer for the telford ccg and said that although measures had already been taken to cut the costs , there might be a `` significant lag '' before the effects are seen on the balance sheets .
mr nash took on the role after the former shropshire ccg finance officer left on secondment and said he was coming in with a clear message that the ccg had to live within its means .
i get up every morning to improve the health outcomes of the populations of shropshire .
just like the professional clinicians do n't want to reduce expenditure in a way that harms patients , neither do i . ''

text: the british dairy industry is holding a big conference at the telford international centre today .
last year the event attracted over 7,000 visitors and as well as the trade stands and demonstrations there will be livestock competitions in the main hall .
the event , now in its third year , is held in september because its the time of year when dairy farmers are making important decisions ahead of the winter months .

documents.title: west midlands unemployment up by 17,000
text: the number of people without jobs and looking for work increased in the west midlands by 17,000 to 176,000 between may and july , official figures show .
it 's the biggest rise , compared with the previous quarter , for any region in the uk .
across the country , unemployment fell by 39,000 to 1.63 million for the same period .
the ons said the figures , which only cover one month since the result of the eu referendum , show `` continuing improvement '' in the jobs market .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: auditors warn of 'difficult years ahead ' for ccg
text: auditors grant thornton have told a meeting of the shropshire ccg that they can expect 'difficult years ahead ' as they try to bring their deficit under control .
they audit around a third of all ccgs and said this year 's annual report into the shropshire finances were probably the most difficult they have ever done .
grant thornton said it had experienced difficulties in obtaining prompt responses to queries and requests for supporting papers .

documents.title: meeting told ccg deficit could almost double by april 2017
text: the shropshire clinical commissioning group is meeting to discuss its worsening financial situation and there 's a warning that things could get a lot worse if steps are n't taken now .
the ccg is forecast to be £ 18m overspent by the end of the year , but it says that if nothing is done , that could almost double to £ 31m by the end of the financial year in april 2017

documents.title: rifles granted freedom of shrewsbury
text: about 120 troops are due to march through shrewsbury this afternoon as the rifles regiment is granted the freedom of the town .
the king 's shropshire light infantry was awarded the freedom of shrewsbury in 1958 and the celebrations included a parade through the town .
when they merged to become part of the rifles , that honour then transferred to the new regiment which has a reserve company at copthorne barracks .
the event starts with a service at st chad 's church at 13:00 , followed by a parade , an hour later .

documents.title: sport : afc telford boss apologises after 3-0 defeat

he added that the players are n't showing any spirit at the moment and something must be done to get it right .

documents.title: football : telford striker hibbert says performances must improve
text: telford striker dave hibbert says the players know performances must improve , after saturday 's 3-1 defeat to gainsborough .
telford take on gloucester tonight and hibbert said he was `` extremely frustrated '' with the way they played at the weekend and that `` we should be doing better '' .
telford are 13th in the table , seven points behind today 's opponents .
we have to pull together and make sure we put on a performance that the fans deserve and a result that the fans deserve . ''

documents.title: canoeist death an accident , inquest finds
text: an inquest has recorded a verdict of accidental death on a shropshire man found dead in a lake .
the body of 56-year-old robert simcock was found in a small lake in bridgnorth in june .
he 'd been canoeing near his home in underton and was found after an underwater search .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: museums still hopeful of buying ornamental vase
text: five ornamental pieces of china , with links to shropshire , have been bought by the ironbridge gorge museums - but fundraising continues to buy a larger piece , known as the northumberland vase .
they are part of a larger collection which had been on loan at the museums , before the owner decided to sell them .
the museums want to raise £ 50,000 to stand a chance of winning the auction for the vase in november .
they believe it is one of the largest pieces of coalport china ever made .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : afc telford united away to gloucester city
text: afc telford united travel to face gloucester city tonight - a side that beat them home and away last season .
midfielder jack rea is still recovering from a knee injury and will miss the game , but could be fit for saturday .
manager rob smith said that despite their limited budget , gloucester are always hard to beat and he is under `` no illusions '' about how difficult the game will be .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: council leader welcomes constituency boundary proposals
text: the proposals for an urban `` telford '' constituency and a more rural `` wrekin '' one are broadly what the council asked , its leader says .
the proposed changes to shropshire 's constituency boundaries has been welcomed by shaun davies .
cllr davies said the council had been opposed to the original plan to create telford north and telford south constituencies .
the boundary commission has listened to us and we are very happy with their latest proposals .
they not only satisfy the commission 's population and geographical criteria , they also respect and maintain the identities of the communities in our borough . ''

documents.title: jailed shropshire businessman facing financial ruin
text: a respected businessman who drove a distinctive yellow lamborghini and who was jailed for fencing '' stolen goods for a criminal gang that targeted asian gold now faces possible financial ruin .

documents.title: new constituencies : shrewsbury
text: the shrewsbury and atcham constituency would expand to take in chirbury and worthen under proposals to cut the number of mps by the next election .
the seat would also lose `` atcham '' from its current name .
here 's a map of the proposed new constituency .

documents.title: cycle ride to raise money for leisure centre
text: a man has set off on a five-day , 180 km ( 112 mile ) , cycle ride from shropshire to the top of snowdon , to raise money for his local leisure centre .
the sparc centre is under threat because shropshire council is reducing funding for leisure services , as part of wider budget cuts .
david luckhurst , from bishop 's castle , is supporting the save the sparc campaign , which is trying to keep it open .
mr luckhurst is hoping to raise £ 1,500 from his ride , as a contribution to the £ 50,000 needed to refurbish the pool .
but , he did n't get off to a great start , reporting a puncture within hours of setting off .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: hot weather forecast for shropshire tomorrow
text: we might be in for a bit of rain this afternoon , but the forecast for tomorrow is looking really good .
temperatures could rise to as high as 27c ( 81f ) in parts of the county .

documents.title: start of m54 roadworks could be held up by limekiln roundabout work
text: the work to improve junction four of the m54 is scheduled to start at the beginning of october , but it could be held up if work at the limekiln roundabout over-runs further .
telford and wrekin council says it would be too disruptive to have both projects going on at the same time .
assuming work can start on time , the authority says it should all be complete by march .

documents.title: new constituencies : telford
text: under proposed boundary reforms which would cut the number of mps in the house of commons voters in donnington , hadley & leegomery will move into the telford constituency from the wrekin .
here 's what the new constituency would look like .

documents.title: new constituencies : bridgnorth , wellington and the wrekin
text: the wrekin would be expanded southwards to become bridgnorth , wellington and the wrekin , under proposals which would cut the number of mps in the house of commons .
here 's a map of the proposed new constituency .

documents.title: promise to reduce m54 roadwork disruption
text: work on junction four of the m54 will be nowhere near the same scale as the roadworks we saw when the jaguar land rover factory was built at junction two , telford and wrekin council says .
and the authority has promised to keep disruption to a minimum , saying the roundabout will only need to close when resurfacing work is carried out .
with hundreds of new homes being built in shifnal and priorslee and factory expansions planned for the t54 business park , the council predicts traffic increasing by 30 % over the next 15 years .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: nhs england promising support to shropshire ccg
text: nhs england has promised to help shropshire 's health commissioners out of their growing financial troubles .
shropshire clinical commissioning group is forecast to be £ 18m in debt by the end of this financial year , far higher than the £ 6m overspend which it had planned for .
health campaigners in the county have accused nhs england of failing to support the ccg , something nhs england denies .
we are aware that shropshire ccg 's financial position has continued to deteriorate over recent months .
we have therefore stepped up our support to help it to implement efficiency measures more quickly and to secure a stable financial future through careful forward planning . ''

documents.title: weather : rain across shropshire this afternoon
text: the day started brightly , but we 're forecast rain this afternoon .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: health group blames nhs england over funding issues
text: health campaigners are blaming nhs england for the financial problems faced by the shropshire clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) .
the group that pays for medical services in the county is facing a multi-million pound overspend this year , despite having a turn-around team sent in to try to sort out the situation .
gill george from defend our nhs says there simply is n't enough cash coming into the group in the first place .
the national funding allocations formula discriminates against rural areas like shropshire and areas with an older population . ''

documents.title: m54 roadworks to start next month
text: work to improve junction 4 of the m54 is due to start next month .
extra filter-lanes and traffic lights are being added to help it cope with an expected increase in traffic to and from the new t54 business park .
it 's hoped the work will help to improve the current interchange to cope with an anticipated increase of traffic up to 2030 .
planners also want to make the roundabout more cycle-friendly .
the work is expected to last 20 weeks .

documents.title: charity walk for bridgnorth girl set to beat target
text: a sponsored walk in memory of a 15-month-old bridgnorth girl who died from meningitis looks set to beat its target of raising £ 1,000 , organisers say .
fleur-rose allen 's parents said she lost her life within a few hours of first appearing unwell and they want to raise awareness of the disease and its symptoms .
the `` toddle waddle '' is being held on sunday 2 october and starts at st leonards church in bridgnorth castle gardens , starting at 11:00 .
what happened to fleur-rose shows what a horrific disease meningitis can be .
we want to raise awareness of this and the signs and symptoms , so no other families have to suffer in this way . ''

documents.title: rail replacement buses between shrewsbury and wrexham .
text: buses are replacing trains between shrewsbury and wrexham general , the national rail website says .
a replacement bus service will run every 60 minutes between the two stations .
the disruption is caused a signalling staff member falling ill and it is hoped the rail service will be back on track by 11am .

documents.title: silver for shropshire in the archery
text: a silver medal for shropshire at the paralym overnight - telford 's jodie grinham and her partner john stubbs were beaten by china in the final of the mixed team compound in the archery competition .
they reached the gold medal match by beating south korea but lost the final 151-143 .
the 23-year-old described last night 's medal performance as `` amazing '' .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: shropshire 's political map to be redrawn by the next election
text: shropshire could no longer have five mps purely serving the county .
the boundary commission has been tasked with cutting the commons from 650 to 600 seats , to make them more equal in size and reduce the number of mps .
some new seats , like the proposed ludlow and leominster constituency , will cross county borders .
donnington , hadley and leegomery could move into telford from the wrekin which would be expanded southwards to become `` bridgnorth , wellington and the wrekin '' .
north shropshire remains unchanged but chirbury and worthen would move into the shrewsbury seat which would lose `` atcham '' from its name .

documents.title: ludlow traders concerned by festival traffic
text: traffic is the main concern for local traders around ludlow food festival weekend , according to the chair of the event committee , phil maile .
he said around half the shopkeepers are concerned about the impact it has on their business and the lack of parking is a big part of that .
mr maile also said that he 'd been talking to the traders , to try to find solutions and that he thinks the concerns have decreased in recent years .
there 's always a little bit of resentment that local shoppers have trouble parking in the town . ''

documents.title: cricket : shropshire 's chairman of selectors steps down
text: shropshire 's chairman of selectors , brian foxall , has announced he is stepping down from the role .

he said he took the decision to spend more time with his family and the minor county says it is in no way connected with the player-registration mix-up which effectively cost shropshire the western division title .
mr foxall was also the county 's vice-chairman , matchday announcer and edited the club 's annual handbook .
i 've enjoyed it and meeting so many people from all around the country over the years has been very nice .
it 's also been lovely to meet so many cricketers and see lots of lads , not just from shropshire but other minor counties , make their name in first-class cricket . ''

documents.title: voting on shifnal development plan this week
text: this week , people living in shifnal are going to be asked if they back a local plan which has been drawn up - setting out how the town should be developed .
if the town votes in favour of the shifnal neighbourhood plan on thursday , then it must be considered when planning applications go to shropshire council in the future .
as well as setting out which land is suitable for housing , the plan includes proposals for improving leisure facilities , transport and town centre shops .

documents.title: four months of roadworks for m54 junction
text: alterations to junction four of the m54 will result in 20 weeks of roadworks , starting next month .
telford and wrekin council says extra filter lanes and traffic lights are being added to help it cope with an expected increase in traffic and to make it easier for cyclists to cross .
there will also be improvements to the road surface on the slip roads , new crash barriers and better footpaths .

documents.title: ludlow festival chair tries to sell benefits to local traders
text: the chair of the ludlow food festival says `` there 's something wrong '' if local traders ca n't make money from the thousands of people who visit the annual event .
phil maile said shopkeepers were 50-50 in their support for the festival , which sells over 20,000 tickets and attracts thousands more to the wider town , outside the castle walls .
mr maile said the festival organisers had been doing more this year to support the local traders and persuade them that the event is a good thing .
when you 've probably got the best part of 25 to 30 thousand people in town , if you ca n't take a little bit of money off them , there 's something wrong . ''

documents.title: cricket : shifnal secure promotion to first division
text: shifnal cricket club has won promotion to the first division of the birmingham league .
they beat relegation-threatened oswestry by 49 runs to secure the points they needed .
captain tom collins said everyone in the team had played a part and being in charge during a promotion-season was an experience he would never forget .
the club has n't won much silverware in the last 10 , 20 years , so it 's fantastic for the club . ''
author: BBC Sport

nine times out of 10 a team have got a plan to try and keep it nil nil or one goal in it as long as possible .
obviously , as soon as we got a second that changed the complexity of the game completely . ''

documents.title: college merger might result in cuts
text: the new ceo in charge of the shrewsbury sixth form and shewsbury college merger has pledged students would not see a reduction in the number of courses as a direct result of the move .
but , lyn surgeon , who was appointed last month , said there may be changes as a result of `` changing and developing need '' in the future and that the merger might involve efficiency savings .
there had been fears that it might reduce the number of options available to students .
it would be disingenuous not to say that in any merger you are looking how you can be more efficient .
but the efficiencies need to drive improvements in teaching and learning . ''

documents.title: football : gainsborough 3-1 afc telford
text: after an impressive win in midweek , telford 's performance at gainsborough was far from that as the bucks lost 3-1 .
the lincolnshire side dominated the first half and took a two-goal lead after the break before josh wilson struck for rob smith 's side against the run of play .
but gainsborough made the game safe late on after ben bailey , who gave away the penalty for trinity 's opener , was sent off for the bucks following a second yellow card .
further injuries meant telford finished the game with only nine players on the pitch .
telford drop to 13th in the national north table .
